definition: the power of sb or sth evil/the clutches (of a bad person etc)
palm of the hand/sole of the foot/paw/horseshoe/to slap/to hold in one's hand/to wield

sentences.english: In June 1940 Paris fell to the Nazis.
Once he was in the clutches of the enemy he knew he'd never escape.
sentences.chinese: 他一落入敵人的魔掌，就知道再也逃不脫了。

sentences.english: There is no escape from me.
sentences.chinese: 真的是逃不過我的魔掌。

sentences.english: Slow fire with him and they had each other, want to party want to escape the clutches.
sentences.chinese: 他和文火伴們相依爲命，想方想辦法逃出魔掌。

sentences.english: Street children in this part of the world often fall prey to drug dealers.
sentences.chinese: 這個地方的街頭流浪兒童常常落入毒販子的魔掌中。

definition: to catch/to grapple with/to hold onto
to throw off/to struggle free of/Taiwan pr. [zheng1 tuo1]
to get away/to escape (from obligations)/to free oneself/to disengage
variant of 厄運|厄运[e4 yun4]
to prevail/to have one's way/to get away with it
malign agent who manipulates from behind the scenes/hidden hand/(Tw) mechanic/blue-collar worker/manual laborer
